comment: Dr. Estime was a very friendly, funny professor. He gives tough homework every week but you need it to do good on the exams. The homework he gives is extremely helpful in understanding the content and takes time but isn't not overwhelming.
Dr. Estime is an excellent professor, I had him for a Tuesday night 8PM lab and he was always very helpful in explaining the night's lab.

He teaches really well, explains most things as simple as they can be, and makes sure everyone is ready to move to the next topic by always asking if anyone has questions. Get ready to do lots of examples in class or get out early. If you get him for lab he's really chill.

I had Dr E for lab, but I can tell what kind of professor he is. Chem 1212 is hard and tons of work, regardless of who is teaching. Dr E is very kind, knowledgeable, and helped me learn lecture material through the lab. Highly recommend him. For lab, it is very easy to get an A if you stay and finish it in class. He will help you if you get stuck!

Barely passed my chemistry class last semester with a different professor, however, I got an A in his class. Homework and tests aren't hard as long as you study outside of class. He is very nice and cares a lot about his students.

Despite other posts, this professor was Great! Would take again 100%
He answers students, goes through problems in class, gives out study guides for each test.
One or two hw worksheets per week, and he drops the 2 lowest HW grade PER UNIT.
The textbook was free and completely online.
The final is allowed to sub previous test grades and vice versa.
great teacher!!! definitely would retake the class

The only reason people are saying his class was hard because of all the homework and the homework videos along with it. But overall the HW assignments help with your grade at the end of the semester. Helps going to class, what he saids in class is important. As long as your willing to go to class and put effort into some study time you will pass.
The class is based on PowerPoints, you go through it on your own time before class. I recommend to try and take someone else. You'll be teaching yourself all semester.

Take literally anyone else if possible. The class was basically online despite being an in-person class. Every other day you have to watch about 3-6 "lecture videos" and answer questions after. There would also be a huge homework assignment on top of that. During class the material continued to be very vague and a waste of so much time.
Do not take him if possible! He assigns tons of homework and quizzes that are required before class starts. You have to teach yourself basically everything and he's not helpful when you ask.
doesnt really do much or grade quickly

AWFUL professor! He just summarizes stuff in class, and you have to learn from his videos at home. 20+ hours of work every week for the simplest class. DO NOT TAKE HIM. Tests are relatively easy, but you would need to know chemistry before going into his class, because you're not learning anything in there.

Unless you have a good grasp on the basics of Chem already I would take a different professor. There is TONS of homework and a few you have to look for yourself because the assignments do not show up on d2l. If you understand the material from the videos tests her moderately easy & all are multiple choice.

signed up as in person but he makes it flipped classroom; you watch 3-6 20 minute videos before class, have online homework assignments( around 1 hour each), then quizzes online. In person he reviews with word problems based off of the concepts which kind of helps but he doesnt really review them/ expects you to learn from online videos

I didn't like the way this class worked, basically you both learn and do assignments at home(easily 12 hours of homework + online lectures each week). The only thing you do in class is work on some problems that you are expected to already know from the online lectures, that means you have to teach yourself everything and classes are not helpful.

First problem, I signed up for an in person class and he makes you do everything virtually at home which I probably averaged 9 hrs doing a week. Second, half of his material is inaccurate. If he ever does an in person lecture you will retain nothing and have to reteach yourself. Fourth, he refuses to respond to emails.

Absolutely terrible. Do not take this class. He is so short in his emails and his material is wrong a lot of the time. You have to teach yourself everything. Also each homework takes hours and the videos that he "teaches" with are extremely time consuming.
homework takes forever you have to teach yourself does not explain well
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I personally had an okay time in this class. If you don't like to teach yourself I would not take him. His homework is mastering chemistry and takes about 4 hours each time. This is defiantly a time consuming class but I didn't think his test were too hard.

He is such a nice guy but his teaching methods suck. You are expected to watch videos to teach yourself the material and the exams are extremely hard. The exams are so much of the overall grade which sucks. If you are good at chemistry you will be fine but if you need to be taught face to face then do not take this course.

flipped classroom so he posts lectures before class, class time is just a review PowerPoint with world problems. You learn on your own, dont expect him to teach so take only if you have 4-5 hours a week to learn on your own & if youre good at teaching yourself. 2 homework assignments a week take up between 1-4 hours too !

this is a lab class so there is no way you can get away with skipping. labs and lab quizzes are easy given you did the lab report. lab final is very easy, paper final equally so. don't be worried if you don't understand the lab instructions before showing up because he'll tell you what to do.

Does not know how to put in grades to save his life. Makes it a lot more complicated than it is. Learned more from a 20 minute SI session than the whole class. Do not recommend unless you want to teach yourself the whole time.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I had him for lab and he is a nice guy and very understanding. Drops two lab reports, he is a SLOW grader but he is super laid back. Super chill.

He doesnt respond to emails at all. he is very lenient with due dates but its doesnt matter if he doesnt respond to emails. he wont change the grade because he doesnt answer emails at all. youll have to catch him in class. you have to basically teach yourself. he doesnt guide you, so come already knowing prior chem knowledge.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Taking Estime is a niche choice: know your pros/cons. Very lenient in lab NB expectations, but HORRIBLE at communicating. Never answers emails to the pt it's unprofessional. No grades until finals week. Really. Very hands-off & unsupportive. Take if you want a lax, hands-off prof who doesn't care ab you & if you are responsible to keep up.

Had him for 11 & 12. Taking Estime is a niche choice: know your pros/cons. Very lenient in lab NB expectations, but HORRIBLE at communicating. Never answers emails to the pt it's unprofessional. No grades until finals week. Really. Very hands-off & unsupportive. Take if you want a lax, hands-off prof who doesn't care ab you & if you are responsible
does NOT reply to emails and never explains anything.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Would give negative if possible
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Do not take this class unless its your last option, he never replies to emails and he expects you to do everything to do by yourself.

I received an A, but it was all my work. This was an online summer course (no meetings & 8 weeks long). He assigned pages in a textbook, that i never read, provided some videos off of youtube, and gave us a WS to do each week. I taught myself the material with struggling and was able to, by some grace of god, do well. Take him to teach yourself....

8wk summer course (asynchronous): He didn't go over material, just gave slides and worksheets. Doesn't go over tests, answer keys are sometimes wrong, and does not answer his emails. No communication, no feedback, no lectures, and very unorganized. He did drop lowest WS and test but it doesn't help much. ACS final was rough and he only curved it 5%

Nice guy. Knows what hes talking about. There are quizzes every lab at the start of class. The quizzes are based on the labs prior. You can use your lab notebook on them. Make sure you complete ur lab notebook each week and complete the assignments. If you do these things you should be fine.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof Estime is relatable, young, and wants you to do well. However, in labs he expects you to know things before you are taught in reg 1211. He is always willing to help and explain though sometimes he seemed uninterested in questions asked.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria
